snippet: New York City will commit $8.2 billion in public funds to a 10-year housing plan, while providing affordable homes to thousands of low- to middle-income residents, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces that city will commit $8.2 billion in public funds to a 10-year housing plan that could transform the cityscape while providing affordable homes to thousands of low- to middle-income residents; de Blasio intends to require developers to include affordable units in residential projects in newly rezoned areas around the city.

byline.original: By MIREYA NAVARRO and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: New York City will commit $8.2 billion in public funds to a 10-year housing plan, while providing affordable homes to thousands of low- to middle-income residents, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced.

headline.main: De Blasio Sets a 10-Year Plan for Housing, Putting the Focus on Affordability
